description: It represents the alarm information forwarded to NMS in
case of a new occurrence.
Depending on the capabilities of the managed network elements
AND of the FM application in NetAct, some of the alarm
parameters (e.g. nbiProposedRepairAction) may not yet be
supported.
The parameter nbiSequenceId identifies unambiguously a
notification (which passed the possible filter check) and
has been forwarded towards the managing NMS (it is a NMS-
specific value, because each NMS may define different filters
regarding notification forwarding). This parameter, incremented
for each forwarded notification, allows for the detection of
lost traps. The value of the parameter alarmId is set for each
new occurrence and is used in all subsequent notifications
related to this alarm (alarm acknowledgement, alarm severity
changed, alarm comment, alarm cleared). Also the alarm
parameters used for filtering out purposes (alarm type, object
instance and perceived severity) are present in all subsequent
notifications related to this alarm (alarm acknowledgement
alarm severity changed, alarm comment, alarm cleared).
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiAlarmNewNotification NSN-SNMP-NBI-COMMONFUNCTIONS-MIB::nbiSequenceId i 9999 NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiAlarmId s EXAMPLE NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiAlarmType i 1 NSN-SNMP-NBI-COMMONFUNCTIONS-MIB::nbiObjectInstance s EXAMPLE NSN-SNMP-NBI-COMMONFUNCTIONS-MIB::nbiEventTime s EXAMPLE NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiAlarmTime s EXAMPLEE NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiProbableCause i 9999 NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiSpecificProblem s EXAMPLE NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiPerceivedSeverity i 1 NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiProposedRepairAction s EXAMPLE NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiAdditionalText s EXAMPLE NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiOptionalInformation s EXAMPLE

description: The object represents the NMS-specific sequence number
of the current trap which already passed the filter check
and has been forwarded at NBI.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-COMMONFUNCTIONS-MIB::nbiSequenceId

description: It unambiguously identifies (within NetAct scope) all
events regarding the same fault:
nbiAlarmNewNotification, nbiAlarmAckChangedNotification
nbiAlarmChangedNotification
nbiAlarmCommentNotification, nbiAlarmClearedNotification
nbiAlarmSyncNotification.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiAlarmId

description: This object indicates the type of alarm trap forwarded to the
managing NMS.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiAlarmType

description: This type represents the concatenation of different RDN
information and allows for the precise recognition of the
resource by NMS operator. The DN components are separated
by means of the slash ('/') character. The max. DN length
is 256 characters.
DN example:
NSNNetwork-1/RNC-2/UtranCell-7
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-COMMONFUNCTIONS-MIB::nbiObjectInstance

description: This object indicates the NetAct generation time of the
notification forwarded over the northbound interface.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-COMMONFUNCTIONS-MIB::nbiEventTime

description: This object indicates the time a new alarm has been generated
in the faulty resource. In case some NEs do not support (or
do not deliver) this information, the value is the same as
nbiEventTime.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiAlarmTime

description: This object indicates the probable cause of each alarm
forwarded to the managing NMS.
Depending on the managed domain/technology, a dedicated list
of probable cause values is used at runtime.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiProbableCause

description: This object provides more detailed (vendor-specific)
information about the probable cause of each alarm forwarded
to the managing NMS. It is an empty string in the case
this information is not available.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiSpecificProblem

description: This object indicates the severity of the alarm.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiPerceivedSeverity

description: This object provides operator hints about possible repair
actions as specified by the managed entities. It is an empty
string in the case this information is not available.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiProposedRepairAction

description: This object may contain further information provided in the
original NE alarm or associated with the current alarm as a
concatenation of different name-value strings, e.g. the
original probableCause value (if any).
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiAdditionalText

description: This object may contain optional, configurable
information, according to customer-specific needs (e.g.
site-related information, maintenance region or other
data).
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiOptionalInformation

description: It represents the alarm acknowledgement information forwarded
to NMS in case an alarm has been acknowledged or
unacknowledged.
The parameter nbiSequenceId identifies unambiguously a
notification (which passed the possible filter check) and
has been forwarded towards the managing NMS (NMS-specific
value). This parameter, incremented for each forwarded
notification, allows for the detection of lost traps.
The parameter nbiAlarmId allows for correlation with the
previous new alarm occurrence.
In case one NMS previously set filter constructs related to
filterable alarm parameters (alarm type, object instance and
perceived severity), such acknowledgement notifications
may not be forwarded towards NMS.
The parameters nbiAckState, nbiAcksystemId, nbiAckTime and
nbiAckUser provide information about the last acknowledgement
activity.

Summary.eval: ($v7 ne '') ? '$v7' : ($v8==5) ? '$v3 acknowledged and cleared' : '$v3 unacknowledged and forwarded to NMS. $v9'

notification forwarded over the northbound interface.

variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiPerceivedSeverity

description: This object may contain further information provided in the
original NE alarm or associated with the current alarm as a
concatenation of different name-value strings, e.g. the
original probableCause value (if any).
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiAdditionalText

description: It indicates whether the alarm is already acknowledged
or unacknowledged.
The value 'acknowledged' (1) corresponds to a currently
acknowledged alarm.
The value 'unacknowledged' (2) relates to an alarm which has
been acknowledged and subsequently unacknowledged.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiAckState

description: It provides the identification of the system on which
the current alarm has been acknowledged or unacknowledged.
The value may be empty in case the information is not
available (e.g. in case of NMS acknowledgement request
without system identifier).
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiAckSystemId

description: This object is used to indicate the time the current alarm
has been acknowledged or unacknowledged and is set by the SNMP
Agent.
In case an alarm has been not yet acknowledged or
unacknowledged, the parameter is an empty string.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiAckTime

description: It provides the identification of the user who acknowledged
or unacknowledged the current alarm.
The value is empty in case an alarm has been not yet
acknowledged or unacknowledged (e.g. a new alarm) and
may be empty in case the information is not available
(e.g. in case of NMS acknowledgement request without
user identifier).
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiAckUser

description: This object may contain optional, configurable
information, according to customer-specific needs (e.g.
site-related information, maintenance region or other
data).
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiOptionalInformation

description: It represents the alarm information forwarded to NMS in case
the alarm parameters such as nbiPerceivedSeverity
nbiSpecificProblem of an alarm is/are changed.
Depending on the capabilities of the managed network elements
AND of the FM application in NetAct, some of the alarm
parameters (e.g. nbiProposedRepairAction) may not yet be
supported.
The parameter nbiSequenceId identifies unambiguously a
notification (which passed the possible filter check) and
has been forwarded towards the managing NMS (NMS-specific
value). This parameter, incremented for each forwarded
notification, allows for the detection of lost traps.
The parameter nbiAlarmId allows for correlation with the
previous new alarm occurrence.
In case one NMS previously set filter constructs related to
filterable alarm parameters (alarm type, object instance and
perceived severity), such notifications may not be
forwarded towards NMS.
The parameters contain the changed alarm value.

variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiOptionalInformation

description: It represents the alarm information forwarded to NMS in case
an operator note has been added to an alarm.
The parameter nbiSequenceId identifies unambiguously a
notification (which passed the possible filter check) and
has been forwarded towards the managing NMS (NMS-specific
value). This parameter, incremented for each forwarded
notification, allows for the detection of lost traps.
The parameter nbiAlarmId allows for correlation with the
previous new alarm occurrence.
In case one NMS previously set filter constructs related to
filterable alarm parameters (alarm type, object instance and
perceived severity), such notifications may not be
forwarded towards NMS.
The parameters nbiCommentText, nbiCommentTime and
nbiCommentUser provide information about the alarm
commenting activity.
CURRENTLY NOT YET SUPPORTED.

description: This object indicates the NetAct generation time of the
notification forwarded over the northbound interface.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-COMMONFUNCTIONS-MIB::nbiEventTime

description: This object indicates the probable cause of each alarm
forwarded to the managing NMS.
Depending on the managed domain/technology, a dedicated list
of probable cause values is used at runtime.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiProbableCause

description: This object provides more detailed (vendor-specific)
information about the probable cause of each alarm forwarded
to the managing NMS. It is an empty string in the case
this information is not available.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiSpecificProblem

description: This object indicates the severity of the alarm.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiPerceivedSeverity

description: This object may contain further information provided in the
original NE alarm or associated with the current alarm as a
concatenation of different name-value strings, e.g. the
original probableCause value (if any).
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiAdditionalText

description: This object provides the comment (operator note) assigned
to the alarm. In case no comment has been added to the
alarm, this parameter is an empty string.
CURRENTLY NOT YET SUPPORTED.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiCommentText

description: This object is used to indicate the time as a comment
(operator note) has been assigned to the current alarm and is
set by the SNMP Agent.
In case no comment has been added to the alarm, the
parameter value is an empty string.
CURRENTLY NOT YET SUPPORTED.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiCommentTime

description: The object value provides the identification of the user who
added a comment to the current alarm.
The value is an empty string in case no comment (operator note)
has been added to the alarm and may be empty in case the
information is not available (e.g. in case the comment has
been done by NMS operator, without user identifier in NMS
request).
CURRENTLY NOT YET SUPPORTED.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiCommentUser

description: This object may contain optional, configurable
information, according to customer-specific needs (e.g.
site-related information, maintenance region or other
data).
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiOptionalInformation

description: It represents the alarm information forwarded to NMS in case
the severity of an alarm has changed to value 'clear'. If the
alarm has been previously acknowledged, it shall be removed
from the list of managed alarms.
The parameter nbiSequenceId identifies unambiguously a
notification (which passed the possible filter check) and
has been forwarded towards the managing NMS (NMS-specific
value). This parameter, incremented for each forwarded
notification, allows for the detection of lost traps.
The parameter nbiAlarmId allows for correlation with the
previous new alarm occurrence.
In case one NMS previously set filter constructs related to
filterable alarm parameters (alarm type, object instance and
perceived severity), such notifications may not be
forwarded towards NMS.
The parameters nbiClearSystemId, nbiClearTime and nbiClearUser
indicate the identifier of the system on which the alarm has
been cleared, the alarm clearing time and the identifier of
the operator who cleared the alarm.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiAlarmClearedNotification NSN-SNMP-NBI-COMMONFUNCTIONS-MIB::nbiSequenceId i 9999 NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiAlarmId s EXAMPLE NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiAlarmType i 1 NSN-SNMP-NBI-COMMONFUNCTIONS-MIB::nbiObjectInstance s EXAMPLE NSN-SNMP-NBI-COMMONFUNCTIONS-MIB::nbiEventTime s EXAMPLE NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiProbableCause i 9999 NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiSpecificProblem s EXAMPLE NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiPerceivedSeverity i 1 NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiAdditionalText s EXAMPLE NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiClearSystemId s EXAMPLE NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiClearTime s EXAMPLE NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiClearUser s EXAMPLE NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiOptionalInformation s EXAMPLE

managing NMS.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiAlarmType

information and allows for the precise recognition of the
resource by NMS operator. The DN components are separated
by means of the slash ('/') character. The max. DN length
is 256 characters.
DN example:
NSNNetwork-1/RNC-2/UtranCell-7
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-COMMONFUNCTIONS-MIB::nbiObjectInstance

description: This object indicates the NetAct generation time of the
notification forwarded over the northbound interface.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-COMMONFUNCTIONS-MIB::nbiEventTime

description: This object indicates the probable cause of each alarm
forwarded to the managing NMS.
Depending on the managed domain/technology, a dedicated list
of probable cause values is used at runtime.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiProbableCause

description: This object provides more detailed (vendor-specific)
information about the probable cause of each alarm forwarded
to the managing NMS. It is an empty string in the case
this information is not available.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiSpecificProblem

description: This object indicates the severity of the alarm.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiPerceivedSeverity

description: This object may contain further information provided in the
original NE alarm or associated with the current alarm as a
concatenation of different name-value strings, e.g. the
original probableCause value (if any).
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiAdditionalText

description: It provides the identification of the system on which
the current alarm has been (manually / automatically) cleared.
The value may be empty in case the information is not
available (e.g. in case of NMS clear alarm request
without system identifier)..
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiClearSystemId

description: This object is used to indicate the time the current alarm
has been cleared (it iset by the SNMP Agent). In case of an
active alarm the parameter value is an empty string.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiClearTime

description: The object value provides the identification of the user who
cleared the current alarm. The value is empty in case of an
active alarm and may be empty in case the information is not
available (e.g. in case of manual alarm clearing done by NMS
operator, without user identifier in NMS request).
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiClearUser

description: This object may contain optional, configurable
information, according to customer-specific needs (e.g.
site-related information, maintenance region or other
data).
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiOptionalInformation

description: It represents the full alarm information forwarded to NMS in
case of alarm synchronization using NetAct FM database
information (at synchronization time the alarm may be already
acknowledged, alarm may be cleared but not yet
acknowledged etc.).
Depending on the capabilities of the managed network elements
AND of the FM application in NetAct, some of the alarm
parameters (e.g. nbiProposedRepairAction) may not yet be
supported.
In case of a new alarm, the value of the (conditional) alarm
parameters regarding alarm acknowledgement or clearing is
an empty string.
In case of an acknowledged alarm, the value of the
(conditional) alarm parameters regarding alarm clearing is
an empty string.

Summary.eval: ($v8 ne '') ? '$v8' : ($v9==5) ? '$v3 acknowledged and cleared. $v11' : '$v3 unacknowledged and forwarded to NMS. $v11'

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiAlarmSyncNotification NSN-SNMP-NBI-COMMONFUNCTIONS-MIB::nbiSequenceId i 9999 NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiAlarmId s EXAMPLE NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiAlarmType i 1 NSN-SNMP-NBI-COMMONFUNCTIONS-MIB::nbiObjectInstance s EXAMPLE NSN-SNMP-NBI-COMMONFUNCTIONS-MIB::nbiEventTime s EXAMPLE NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiAlarmTime s EXAMPLEE NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiProbableCause i 9999 NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiSpecificProblem s EXAMPLE NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiPerceivedSeverity i 1 NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiProposedRepairAction s EXAMPLE NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiAdditionalText s EXAMPLE NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiAckState i 1 NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiAckSystemId s EXAMPLE NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiAckTime s EXAMPLE NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiAckUser s EXAMPLE NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiClearSystemId s EXAMPLE NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiClearTime s EXAMPLE NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiClearUser s EXAMPLE NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiOptionalInformation s EXAMPLE

description: The object represents the NMS-specific sequence number
of the current trap which already passed the filter check
and has been forwarded at NBI.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-COMMONFUNCTIONS-MIB::nbiSequenceId

description: It unambiguously identifies (within NetAct scope) all
events regarding the same fault:
nbiAlarmNewNotification, nbiAlarmAckChangedNotification
nbiAlarmChangedNotification
nbiAlarmCommentNotification, nbiAlarmClearedNotification
nbiAlarmSyncNotification.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiAlarmId

description: This object indicates the type of alarm trap forwarded to the
managing NMS.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiAlarmType

description: This type represents the concatenation of different RDN
information and allows for the precise recognition of the
resource by NMS operator. The DN components are separated
by means of the slash ('/') character. The max. DN length
is 256 characters.
DN example:
NSNNetwork-1/RNC-2/UtranCell-7
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-COMMONFUNCTIONS-MIB::nbiObjectInstance

description: This object indicates the NetAct generation time of the
notification forwarded over the northbound interface.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-COMMONFUNCTIONS-MIB::nbiEventTime

description: This object indicates the time a new alarm has been generated
in the faulty resource. In case some NEs do not support (or
do not deliver) this information, the value is the same as
nbiEventTime.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiAlarmTime

description: This object indicates the probable cause of each alarm
forwarded to the managing NMS.
Depending on the managed domain/technology, a dedicated list
of probable cause values is used at runtime.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiProbableCause

description: This object provides more detailed (vendor-specific)
information about the probable cause of each alarm forwarded
to the managing NMS. It is an empty string in the case
this information is not available.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiSpecificProblem

description: This object indicates the severity of the alarm.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiPerceivedSeverity

description: This object provides operator hints about possible repair
actions as specified by the managed entities. It is an empty
string in the case this information is not available.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiProposedRepairAction

description: This object may contain further information provided in the
original NE alarm or associated with the current alarm as a
concatenation of different name-value strings, e.g. the
original probableCause value (if any).
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiAdditionalText

description: It indicates whether the alarm is already acknowledged
or unacknowledged.
The value 'acknowledged' (1) corresponds to a currently
acknowledged alarm.
The value 'unacknowledged' (2) relates to an alarm which has
been acknowledged and subsequently unacknowledged.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiAckState

description: It provides the identification of the system on which
the current alarm has been acknowledged or unacknowledged.
The value may be empty in case the information is not
available (e.g. in case of NMS acknowledgement request
without system identifier).
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiAckSystemId

description: This object is used to indicate the time the current alarm
has been acknowledged or unacknowledged and is set by the SNMP
Agent.
In case an alarm has been not yet acknowledged or
unacknowledged, the parameter is an empty string.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiAckTime

description: It provides the identification of the user who acknowledged
or unacknowledged the current alarm.
The value is empty in case an alarm has been not yet
acknowledged or unacknowledged (e.g. a new alarm) and
may be empty in case the information is not available
(e.g. in case of NMS acknowledgement request without
user identifier).
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiAckUser

description: It provides the identification of the system on which
the current alarm has been (manually / automatically) cleared.
The value may be empty in case the information is not
available (e.g. in case of NMS clear alarm request
without system identifier)..
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiClearSystemId

description: This object is used to indicate the time the current alarm
has been cleared (it iset by the SNMP Agent). In case of an
active alarm the parameter value is an empty string.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiClearTime

description: The object value provides the identification of the user who
cleared the current alarm. The value is empty in case of an
active alarm and may be empty in case the information is not
available (e.g. in case of manual alarm clearing done by NMS
operator, without user identifier in NMS request).
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiClearUser

description: This object may contain optional, configurable
information, according to customer-specific needs (e.g.
site-related information, maintenance region or other
data).
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiOptionalInformation

description: This summary notification generated by SNMP-Agent and forwarded
(periodically or on NMS request) to managing NMS gives to
NMS operators the opportunity to check whether NMS alarms are
aligned with NetAct network view. The content of the
notification is NMS-specific since the number of alarms sorted
according their severity depends on NMS-specific filter
settings.
The parameter nbiEmsSynchronizationState indicates whether
NetAct is in sync with all managed NEs or not. Only in case
of full synchronization the parameter nbiNotSyncNEs
has an empty value, otherwise it indicates the DNs of managed
elements without communication towards NetAct.
Note that the time period for sending the alarm summary
notification is the same for all managing NMS.
If one NMS changes the time period, all NMS are informed by
means of a dedicated notification.
If the period is set to 0, the sending of summary notification
is turned off.

Summary.eval: ($v3==3) ? 'NMS alarms are not aligned with NetAct network view' : 'NMS alarms are aligned with NetAct network view'

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiAlarmSummaryNotification NSN-SNMP-NBI-COMMONFUNCTIONS-MIB::nbiSequenceId i 9999 NSN-SNMP-NBI-COMMONFUNCTIONS-MIB::nbiEventTime s EXAMPLE NSN-SNMP-NBI-COMMONFUNCTIONS-MIB::nbiEmsSynchronizationState i 1 NSN-SNMP-NBI-COMMONFUNCTIONS-MIB::nbiNotSyncNEs s EXAMPLE NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiNumberCriticalAlarms i 9999 NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiNumberMajorAlarms i 9999 NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiNumberMinorAlarms i 9999 NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiNumberWarningAlarms i 9999 NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiNumberClearedAlarms i 9999 NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiNumberIndeterminateAlarms i 9999

description: The object represents the NMS-specific sequence number
of the current trap which already passed the filter check
and has been forwarded at NBI.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-COMMONFUNCTIONS-MIB::nbiSequenceId

description: This object indicates the NetAct generation time of the
notification forwarded over the northbound interface.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-COMMONFUNCTIONS-MIB::nbiEventTime

description: It represents the NetAct synchronization state with regard to
the alarm condition in the managed network elements.
The value sync (1) indicates full NetAct alarm synchronization
with the managed elements.
The value partialSync (2) indicates that at least the
communication to one managed element is down. Only in this
case the parameter nbiNotSyncNEs contains the
list of DNs for not synchronized manages elements.
The value noSync (3) is used in case NetAct has not at all
communication to the managed elements.
The information is provided in alarm summary notifications.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-COMMONFUNCTIONS-MIB::nbiEmsSynchronizationState

description: It defines a DN list of network elements (comma-separated)
according to the NbiObjectInstance convention, whose alarm
information is not synchronized with NetAct alarm database.
The information is provided in alarm summary notifications.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-COMMONFUNCTIONS-MIB::nbiNotSyncNEs

description: It represents the current number of alarms with perceived
severity = 'critical' to be reported to NMS in the alarm
summary notification. The value takes into account the
NMS-specific filter settings.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiNumberCriticalAlarms

description: It represents the current number of alarms with perceived
severity = 'major' to be reported to NMS in the alarm
summary notification. The value takes into account the
NMS-specific filter settings.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiNumberMajorAlarms

description: It represents the current number of alarms with perceived
severity = 'minor' to be reported to NMS in the alarm
summary notification. The value takes into account the
NMS-specific filter settings.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiNumberMinorAlarms

description: It represents the current number of alarms with perceived
severity = 'warning' to be reported to NMS in the alarm
summary notification. The value takes into account the
NMS-specific filter settings.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiNumberWarningAlarms

description: It represents the current number of alarms with perceived
severity = 'clear' to be reported to NMS in the alarm
summary notification. The value takes into account the
NMS-specific filter settings.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiNumberClearedAlarms

description: It represents the current number of alarms with perceived
severity = 'indeterminate' to be reported to NMS in the alarm
summary notification. The value takes into account the
NMS-specific filter settings.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-FAULTMANAGEMENT-MIB::nbiNumberIndeterminateAlarms
